intro: Virgulus oblongifolius var. angustatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaf virgulus, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves that are typically narrower than those of the typical variety. The plant produces small, clustered white or yellowish flowers, which are arranged in umbels. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shaded areas. This variant is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate foliage.
